question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Ensure that the generated code is executable for demonstration. Help me create a Fuzhou-themed tourism website with a navigation bar that includes homepage, login, registration, navigation, weather, special tourism products, scenic area details, and scenic area search. The navigation bar should display secondary pages when clicked. Please show the complete code.

checklist.title: Is the Fuzhou-themed tourism website structure fully implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code implements a complete website structure with proper HTML5 semantic elements (header, nav, main, footer) and CSS organization. Check if all required pages are properly linked: homepage, login, registration, navigation, weather, tourism products, scenic area details, and search functionality. Score 0 if the basic structure is missing, 5 if only partial pages are implemented, and 10 if all required pages are structurally complete with proper routing/linking.

checklist.title: Is the navigation bar with secondary pages functionality correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Examine whether the navigation bar includes all required sections and properly implements dropdown/secondary pages functionality. Check if the navigation transitions are smooth, and if proper event handling exists for showing/hiding secondary menus. Verify mobile responsiveness of the navigation system. Deduct 3 points if any section is missing, 5 points if dropdown functionality isn't working, and 3 points if mobile navigation isn't responsive. Full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the Fuzhou-themed design and content appropriately integrated?
checklist.description: Assess whether the website incorporates authentic Fuzhou cultural elements, landmarks, and tourism information. Check for Fuzhou-specific imagery, color schemes reflecting local culture, and accurate descriptions of attractions. Deduct 5 points if generic tourism templates are used without customization, 3 points if Fuzhou-specific content is minimal, and 5 points if key Fuzhou attractions are missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are functional components (login, registration, search, weather) properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the functional components are properly implemented with appropriate input validation, form handling, and API integration (especially for weather data). Check if the search functionality includes filtering options and result display. Deduct 3 points for each non-functional component and 5 points if client-side validation is missing. Score 10 points only if all functional components are properly implemented with error handling.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid inputs, image loading failures, API errors, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive Fuzhou map with hotspots 2. Cultural mini-games showcasing local traditions 3. Virtual tour capabilities with 360° imagery). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple search implementations) 2. Function modules unrelated to tourism (e.g., a built-in calculator) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations that slow page loading). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data/view/controller components), code organization, file structure, and cross-browser compatibility. Deduct 5 points if global CSS/JS variables pollute the namespace; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if no responsive design principles are applied. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (consistent with Fuzhou cultural elements) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast sliding, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
